intro: Thlaspiceras dolichocarpum, commonly known as the long-fruited thlaspiceras, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. It is native to certain regions of Southeast Asia, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant features compound leaves with serrated edges and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a dry, two-lobed capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
